tool.name: RasterPropertyToPolygon

param.name: in_raster
param.dialogReference: The raster layer that contains the values on which to calculate a statistic.
param.pythonReference: The raster layer that contains the values on which to calculate a statistic.

param.name: statistics_type
param.expression: COUNT | MAXIMUM | MINIMUM | RANGE | MEAN | STD | SUM
param.dialogReference:
One of the following statistics calculations

  • COUNT - Calculates the total number of cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • MEAN — Calculates the average of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • MAXIMUM — Determines the largest value of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • MINIMUM — Determines the smallest value of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • RANGE — Calculates the difference between the largest and value of all cells in the value raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • STD — Calculates the standard deviation of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • SUM — Calculates the total value of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.
param.pythonReference:
One of the following statistics calculations

  • COUNT - Calculates the total number of cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • MEAN — Calculates the average of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • MAXIMUM — Determines the largest value of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • MINIMUM — Determines the smallest value of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • RANGE — Calculates the difference between the largest and value of all cells in the value raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • STD — Calculates the standard deviation of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

  • SUM — Calculates the total value of all cells in the raster that belong to the same polygon zone.

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: The polygon input features that define the zones.
param.pythonReference: The polygon input features that define the zones.

param.name: zone_field
param.dialogReference:
The field in the polygon feature layer used to group the features into zones.

For example CatchmentID
param.pythonReference: The field in the polygon feature layer used to group the features into zones.

param.name: update_field
param.dialogReference: The field in the polygon feature layer to be updated with the statistics result.
param.pythonReference: The field in the polygon feature layer to be updated with the statistics result.

tool.summary: Reports a raster property, summarised by zones within a polygon to a results field.
tool.usage:
This tool takes advantage of the Zonal Statistics as Tablegeoprocessing tool before joining the result back to the input features.

Learn more about how Zonal Statistics work

  • An example use case is transfering DEM data onto a building.

  • zone_field should be unique if you do not want to aggregate the results

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Reports a raster property, summarised by zones within a polygon to a results field.
